Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ori,

Great. If you're using the Experiment design that Colin uses in the d=
emos,
then it's pretty easy. Assuming you've created your experiment class,=
 you
just call:

var seed =3D _experiment.LoadPopulation(XmlReader.Create(f=
ilename))[0];

If you would like to see an example of everything pieced tog=
ether, you
could see how we did it for our egalitarian social learning pape=
r:

https://github.com/tansey/social-learning/blob/master/SocialLearningOnl=
y/Program.cs
- We
create the individual on line 58. You can ignore the stuf=
f about creating a
random network. That was just for a particular test of s=
ocial learning.

https://github.com/tansey/social-learning/blob/master/soci=
al_learning/SocialExperiment.cs
-
The LoadPopulation method is line 193.

H=
ope that helps!

Wesley

On Sun, May 13, 2012 at 11:34 AM, =D7=90=D7=95=D7=
=A8=D7=99 =D7=A7=D7=A0=D7=95=D7=9C <oriknoll@...> wrote:

> **

hi,
> we are using the sharpneat version 2.0 library for CSharp.
> thanks
